newsitem.title: POLAND: SWARZEDZ PLANS TO ISSUE 6.6 MLN SHARES.
newsitem.headline: SWARZEDZ PLANS TO ISSUE 6.6 MLN SHARES.

text.p: Polish furniture maker Swarzedzkie Fabryki Mebli SA (Swarzedz) will decide at an extraordinary shareholders meeting on February 8 whether to issue 6.6 million shares, the firm said in a statement.
The statement on Thursday said that 3.125 million shares from the issue would be issued ex-rights.
It gave no further details, but the firm has said it was considering a share or bond issue to pay for its debts.
The company made a 33.7 million zloty net loss in the first 11 months of 1996.
Its main creditors are PBR, Bank Ochrony Srodowiska SA, Bank Gdanski and Powszechny Bank Gospodarczy SA. Swarzedz has not disclosed the size of its debts.
